data.title: 50+ Vendors show Latest Content Management Technologies
data.meta_description: 50+ Vendors to Showcase and Unveil Latest Content Management Technologies at Gilbane San Francisco
data.text:
For Immediate Release:

4/11/06

Exhibit Hall Free to Attend; See the Latest in Enterprise Search, Automated Publishing, Blog and Wiki Technologies, Enterprise Digital Rights Management

Contacts:

Welz & Weisel Communications

Evan Weisel, 703-323-6006

Cell: 703-628-5754

evan@w2comm.com

Cambridge, MA, April 11, 2006. The Gilbane Report and Lighthouse Seminars today announced that the Gilbane Conference on Content Management Technologies San Francisco, taking place April 24-26, 2006 at the Palace Hotel, will offer free attendance to its exhibit hall featuring over 50 content management vendors.

Attendees will see some of the most innovative and cutting-edge content management solutions available on the market today. To view the entire list of exhibitors visit: http://lighthouseseminars.com/gilbane_sf_06/Exhibitors.html

The following highlights some of the content management technologies and solutions that vendors will display:

— acrolinx North America – Following the successful rollout of its content quality management and improvement tools in Europe, acrolinx GmbH announces local support for North American market.

— Avoco Secure – Assume that your documents will be stolen or mislaid…because they will be…see how secure2trust is the answer to your problem and is much more than just eDRM at stand 117.

— Content Management Professionals (CM Pros) – the content management community of practice – providing information, expertise and support to content management professionals and the organizations they serve. Learn more: www.cmprofessionals.org.

— Delphia Consulting, experience in user interface design with a philosophy of focusing on users rather than a website or product. Our passion is providing exceptional online experiences for your users.

— DocZone.com will demonstrate the latest version of their DocZone suite, a hosted application featuring XML/DITA-based authoring, content management, workflow, translation memory, and single source publishing…all for a low monthly fee.

— Elkera will demonstrate its XML-2-Go single source publishing solutions for product documentation and for enterprise content. Elkera XML-2-Go provides exceptional ease of use, low cost development and high self reliance.

— Ektron will demonstrate CMS400.NET V6.0’s new features for creating and managing interactive websites and applications, including blogging, web analytics, polls/surveys, forums, content ratings, AJAX-enabled search, enhanced multi-site support and localization.

— Ephox will preview the world’s first online HTML editor with Track Changes. The new EditLive! version 6.0 can be seamlessly integrated with CMS including IBM, Vignette and Stellent.

— eTouch Systems, a leading provider of content-centric solutions, will introduce eTouch SamePage – a commercial, enterprise wiki solution that combines rich out-of-the-box functionality and wiki simplicity with enterprise-grade scalability, security, and stability.

— FatWire is showcasing software solutions that enable organizations to put content to work by delivering highly targeted and persuasive experiences to customers, partners, and employees.

— Interwoven will be demonstrating its market-leading ECM solutions that empower enterprises to improve customer experience and optimize back office processes. Over 3,400 organizations already rely on Interwoven to accelerate growth.

— Liquid Machines, Inc. will showcase its leading Enterprise Rights Management solutions including the recently announced integrations with Documentum, Google enterprise search products, BlackBerry devices and networked fileshares.

— Nahava will be showcasing solutions focused on providing structure to unstructured content, enabling large organizations to cost effectively migrate legacy data into content centric applications like CMS and Portal.

— Percussion’s Rhythmyx CMS allows organizations to efficiently manage their Web and portal content, documents, and digital assets. Rhythmyx is rated in the Top 6 WCM vendors in the Gartner WCM MarketScope for 2005.

— RedDot Solutions Corporation – Recognized throughout the industry as the fastest to implement and easiest to use, RedDot CMS and LiveServer extend usability, deliver more relevant content, and make site administration simple.

— RepliWeb will showcase how its R-1 Web-Content Mirroring and B-Hub Managed File Transfer Platforms ensure information availability and reduce operating costs associated with delivering content in B2B, eCommerce, and Portal environments.

— SDL International will showcase global information management solutions, including a global Customer Experience management solution, co-developed with Interwoven, that significantly improves global customer satisfaction and loyalty, brand and time-to-market.

— Sitecore’s pure .NET web content management and portal software for growing and evolving organizations provides ease of use, flexibility and scalability, while seamlessly integrating with existing Microsoft platform investments.

— SpringCM will showcase how its web-based, content management solution allows businesses to collaborate and manage all forms of content to deliver the right balance of information flow and centralization.

— Stellent will feature new Universal Content Management blog/wiki/RSS capabilities as well as its recently released Universal Records Management platform, which is the industry’s first enterprise-class records and retention management application.

— The Level is launching Version 5.0 of its Enterprise Portal and Content Management System. Discover how organizations are streamlining the management, localization and delivery of multi-lingual content for audiences worldwide.

— Traction Software will preview the 3.7 release of the award winning TeamPage Enterprise Blog software. TeamPage tackles use-case and integration issues faced by groups deploying blog, wiki and RSS.

— Vasont Systems will demonstrate its latest version of their flagship multilingual content management system, Vasont Version 10, and the standard DITA setup that comes with each system.

— WebSideStory, Inc. (Nasdaq:WSSI), a leading provider of on-demand digital marketing and customer analysis applications, will be showcasing solutions in its Active Marketing Suite(TM), including site search and web content management.

About Gilbane Report Consulting The Gilbane Report serves the content technology and publishing community with publications, conferences and consulting services. The Gilbane Report also administers the Content Technology Works program disseminating best practices with partners Software AG (TECdax:SOW), Sun Microsystems (NASDAQ:SUNW), Artesia Digital Media, a Division of Open Text, Astoria Software, ClearStory Systems (OTCBB:INSS), Context Media (Oracle, NASDAQ: ORCL), Convera (NASDAQ:CNVR), IBM (NYSE:IBM), Idiom, Mark Logic, Open Text Corporation (NASDAQ:OTEX), SDL International (London Stock Exchange:SDL), Vasont Systems, Vignette (NASDAQ:VGN), and WebSideStory (NASDAQ:WSSI). https://gilbane.com, https://gilbane.com/consulting_publishing.html

About Lighthouse Seminars

Lighthouse Seminars’ events cover information technologies and “content technologies” in particular. These include content management of all types, digital asset management, document management, web content management, enterprise portals, enterprise search, web and multi-channel publishing, electronic forms, authoring, content and information integration, information architecture, and e-catalogs. http://www.lighthouseseminars.com

###
